## Description {#details}

An abstract interface for privatizability.

A pointer is privatizable if it can be replaced by a new, private one. Privatizing pointer reduces the use count, interaction between unrelated code parts.

In order for a pointer to be privatizable its value cannot be observed (=nocapture), it is (for now) not written (=readonly &amp; noalias), we know what values are necessary to make the private copy look like the original one, and the values we need can be loaded (=dereferenceable).

Definition at line 4587 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/ipo/attributor-h">Attributor.h</a>.
